content.raw:
I'm testing the example world using the playstation joystick on Xenial and :

* after the first few messages, messages keep being published but the timestamp doesn't change. I also put a print statement next to the lines which set the timestamp and saw that they stop being called after a while.
* Buttons / axes don't seem to be updated even for a single iteration
content.html:
I'm testing the example world using the playstation joystick on Xenial and :

  • after the first few messages, messages keep being published but the timestamp doesn't change. I also put a print statement next to the lines which set the timestamp and saw that they stop being called after a while.
  • Buttons / axes don't seem to be updated even for a single iteration

content.raw: Fixed: 04fc47d
content.html: Fixed: 04fc47d

update.description:
This adds a joystick plugin that reads joystick data and then transmits the data over a topic.

Upgrade to ign-msgs1 and ign-transport4.
update.title: Joy

content.raw: We can wait for the release of those libraries.
content.html: We can wait for the release of those libraries.

content.raw:
I think a zero rate implies nothing will be published. But looking at the code, when the rate is `<= 0` (which includes the default value 0), the interval is set to 1 sec (i.e. 1 Hz). 

Would it be clearer to say that the default rate is 1 Hz?
content.html:
I think a zero rate implies nothing will be published. But looking at the code, when the rate is <= 0 (which includes the default value 0), the interval is set to 1 sec (i.e. 1 Hz).

Would it be clearer to say that the default rate is 1 Hz?

content.raw: Do we want to wait for the release of `ign-msgs1` and `ign-transport4` or to change CI to use prereleases?
content.html: Do we want to wait for the release of ign-msgs1 and ign-transport4 or to change CI to use prereleases?

content.raw: My understanding is that a unique pointer on windows is not guaranteed to be ABI compatible. This is safer.
content.html: My understanding is that a unique pointer on windows is not guaranteed to be ABI compatible. This is safer.

content.raw: Just curious, ign-tools is an optional dependency of ign-transport, and people installing from debs won't have access to the command line tool, right?
content.html: Just curious, ign-tools is an optional dependency of ign-transport, and people installing from debs won't have access to the command line tool, right?

content.html: Suggestion: Add override
